Inconsistencies in the claim: The expert identified several inconsistencies in the claim, such as the false attribution of the bill to Democratic lawmakers Pelosi and Olbermann, the incorrect bill designation (H.B. instead of H.R.), and the absence of any bill matching the description.
Verification of existing bills: The expert checked the existence of any relevant bills and found that a bill with a similar number was introduced by a Republican lawmaker, but it focused on a different topic unrelated to the claim.
Lack of credibility of the source: The expert noted that the website making the claim, Americannews88.com, lacked identifying information and had a disclaimer stating that its content is satirical fiction. This raised doubts about the credibility of the source.
Confirmation from official sources: The expert referred to official sources, such as the U.S. House of Representatives' legislative process and Congress.gov, to confirm that no bill matching the description had been introduced. This further supported the conclusion that the claim was false.
